channel.title: Comments on: Does Alcohol Really Boil Away in Cooking?

item.description: [...] dish makes me “tipsy” even though there is not that much alcohol in it. According to this blog post, some percentage of alocohol still remains after boiling. So, I guess that small amount still [...]

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: It is impossible to get the ethanol content below 5% in water due to the azeotropic effect of water and ethanol mixtures. The only way to get rid of the alcohol is to boil the water off, in which case your food will become a dry hard lump and presumably not very palatable :P
item.content:encoded: It is impossible to get the ethanol content below 5% in water due to the azeotropic effect of water and ethanol mixtures. The only way to get rid of the alcohol is to boil the water off, in which case your food will become a dry hard lump and presumably not very palatable ðŸ˜›
